website_summaries.verdict: The Fitbit Flex 2 doesn't have all of the bells and whistles of other trackers, but it's finally swim-proof, and it does the basics and it does them well.
pros: The Flex 2 is slim and swim-proof, can track basic fitness data and supports a variety of accessories, including pendants
cons: It lacks a display and the more advanced features of other Fitbit trackers.
The LED lights can be confusing

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BEFORE WASTING YOUR $$$
customer_reviews.text: This is GARBAGE. Please do yourself a huge favor and buy anything else. This purchase was a very painful lesson learned. Product lasted one whole month before failing. Oh yes, to be fair, Fitbit offered a free replacement, another junk Chinese sweat shop $2 gadget. Oh, I don't want to forget that they only offer shipping that took 2 F'ing weeks to arrive. Lol. You can't make this stuff up. Lessons learned = Fitbit buyer BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: TDI_Jetta_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This is the only small product offered by Fitbit that is waterproof. After many hours of research, I was led to believe the device would auto-sense watersports. It does not. They have to be entered manually. And, since the device does not have a heart rate monitor, it cannot sense or calculate how hard you're working at your exercise. I will upgrade when I can find a product that measures everything. Do like the sleep tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Vic S.

customer_reviews.title: Why did they have to discontinue this model?
customer_reviews.text: For those of us who aren't into wearable tech, or who are watch aficionados that still want the ability to wear a step counter of sleep tracker, the Flex2 was perfect. Waterproof, tiny, and holding a charge for days, I miss this version of the Fitbit. I understand that Fitbit is trying to challenge Apple Watches and Samsung wearables, but... if you do one thing well, stick with it. I was gifted the first of my watches by a relative and enjoy wearing them. The Flex2 enables me to wear a nice timepiece AND a tracker in a bangle. Please consider bringing something like this minimalist tracker back!
customer_reviews.author: ~T.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great tracking
customer_reviews.text: I have a Iwatch but was challenged by some friends to see who could do the most steps in a month. It’s almost spot on with distance to the Iwatch, really does depict most exercises you do. Love the fact the soft verbatim. Almost wakes me up in the morning. The app is great with many way to track things. I didn’t plan to continue to wear it after the month was up but I enjoy the simplicity of this one and it has some things it tracks. Little different than the Iwatch. I also wear this in the water constantly, I sweat a ton because I run daily and I’ve had it for six months with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Moneeka McPherson

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT- CANNOT bluetooth pair with Samsung Galaxy S9
customer_reviews.text: This device performs well and maintains charge for about 3 days. The biggest tax on the charge seems to be synching with your mobile device. One big problem is that Fitbit Flex 2 does not pair with the Samsung Galaxy S9. This is a known issue and Fitbit tech team has no projected fix posted in their online users forum. In fact they declare the issue resolved. I guess that means they've resolved not to establish the ability to pair this device with your S9 Android OS phone. Works great with the iPhone IOS, but unfortunately I just bought a new Galaxy S9 so I will have to dump this great inexpensive fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Moderately Handy

customer_reviews.title: at for exercise goals and staying healthy
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Flex 2 provides information via the phone by bluetooth. This made it easy it use because of it convenient tracking for heat rate, sleep paterned and exercise levels. I use the fit bit flex 2 for the convenient tracking, but also to wear as fashion. I own a stylish lavender fitbit band and a silver necklace that is designed for the Fitbit. The Fitbit Flex 2 helps in a variety of different ways and doesn't need to be a wrist band, but can also be a necklace and many more things.it is a small light weight device that provides accurate information 100% and helps achieve goals for loosing weight or just keeping track of yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Dee

customer_reviews.title: Excedes expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have had my own for several years and purchased this for a friend. She loves it. To me the best thing is that its 100% waterproof. I've had mine in the ocean, bath, pool, river, and sink at the salon and its still going strong. Battery life seems really good, I think I can go 2 or 3 days without charging it. And thats the only time I've ever taken it off. Only cons i can think of is the auto workouts are hilariously wrong ocassionaly. I've had it say i had an aerobic workout for like 15 mins when in reality i was walking home from a particularly rowdy night at the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: It's good for a year.
customer_reviews.text: I got it 6/2018. It doesn't sync regularly. It's disconnected from PC and can't reconnect. Also having to charge daily. FitBit Tech Support was worthless......45 minutes on tech chat doing Windows testing which I had said I had already done. i.e. reboot, Bluetooth on? turn it off and on, reboot, scan disk etc..... This is the second FitBit and both lasted just over the warranty period and then had issues. I'm going to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K

customer_reviews.title: Good price and product
customer_reviews.text: Got one for me and one for my girlfriend. Helped us stay more active and gave us a nice competition everyday to see who could do more steps and calories burnt. Super simple design. Double tap on the band and it will show your progress according to how many lights light up. Looks good with most any outfit. It has a vibrate option for when you get texts too, which is extremely convenient if you like to have your phone on silent. Very happy with these
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: My experience with flex 2
customer_reviews.text: My wife had the original flex. After much consideration, I decided on the flex 2 versus the other models (with displays) and other products like vivo for the following reasons: 1. I am using this to gauge my movement during the day and track day over day. 2. I have my phone handy if I want this data right there. 3. It's waterproof. 4. Software support and ability to hook up with external fitness tracking software is excellent. 5. Small and light. After over a month, I am well please. It has hit the objectives I targeted. I wish the battery would last a week. In actual use, it's 3-4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Stu - An amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made - Do not buy this model
customer_reviews.text: The unit is poorly made and designed. After reporting to Fitbit it fell out of the brace several times, they sent me a new wristband. Eventually, it fell out of that also. The only reason I found it the first time was because I downloaded an app to search for it. I know it was in the house. This time I have no idea where it fell out. I feel like I was ripped off by Fitbit due to the poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W

customer_reviews.title: a great idea but not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: When the Flex2 works, it is awesome. I enjoyed every moment, and it seemed like an excellent product. However, after about 8 weeks, it stopped vibrating, which means I no longer receive notifications of reaching a goal, reminders to move, call/text notifications, or the silent alarms, all of which are features that made the Flex 2 so good. I discussed this issue with FitBit, and they kindly sent me a replacement. However, the replacement never vibrated. Overall, I would not recommend this product because the promised features are not reliable for the $60 I spent on what is now a step-tracking and sleep-tracking bracelet.
customer_reviews.author: Claire B

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but just awful battery life
customer_reviews.text: I like the slightly smaller form factor of the Flex 2, as compared to the original Flex. The device does basically what I need it to do, and is vastly easier and less frustrating to charge than the original Flex. But its battery life is abysmal. It needs to be charged every day, even when my daily usage consists of a couple of taps to check my progress, and a single daily alarm that is silenced immediately. Not sure why it has such poor battery performance, but until Fitbit fixes the problem, I wouldn't recommend buying this model.
customer_reviews.author: B. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: This product works sometimes and doesn't a lot of the time. It constantly requires resetting and reinstallation of software. Tech support is nice enough, but the answer I got was it was my phone. Not their product. Well it worked for 3 months and stopped working after fitbit updated the firmware so I really don't think my phone has anything to do with it. It's the last fitbit product I buy. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DanK

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can buy pendants and jewelry that the fitbit will fit in. It's been great and I love that it's waterproof. I'm not sure why the price has gone up $130. I paid $59.95 for mine at the end of 2018.
customer_reviews.author: sis

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit with accessory bangle
customer_reviews.text: My coworker put me on to this fitbit because I wanted something that was not bulky, held a charge and blended well with my outfits. The fact that I could put it into an accessory bangle was a major plus. It tracks all the necessary things, sleep, steps, calories, exercise, water and even food. I haven't tried swimming with it but the description says you can do so. I have only taken it off to shower and charge. On a full charge it can last about 3 days. This is not the most recent fitbit and I have tried others but so far this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My fifth FitBit, and my favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth FitBit, and my favorite. I had the larger ones, but did not like them at all. They were too masculine and clunky. They’d wake me up at night whenever rolled over in bed - if not the noise of my metal bracelet, it would knock me in the head, or the lights would wake me. This model is so much easier to wear, less macho, and more water resistant. The Flex 2 records everything the others did except heart rate, which I can count myself. The sleep record is slightly less precise, but I don’t care, it still records sleep. I just wish the app interfaced with CarbManager.
customer_reviews.author: V. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, style and size - works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for middle aged man wanting to be more aware of fitness. Could not have been more perfect. He talks about it at least once a day, he loves the sleep tracker as well as the exercise tracker. He has been exercising more too! As this design is slimmer and lighter than most, with a simpler display, he is thrilled with it. Previously he did not like the fitbit because of the heavy watch like feel, but he loves this one. Would buy again, may get one for myself - its definately a stylish upgrade from my older fitbit 2. Charges easily, last for days. Good item.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kinzler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't record accurately
customer_reviews.text: I've had my fitbit for three months and I'm pretty disappointed. It stopped recording large chunks of my activity and exercise just a month after I got it. I sent it back and it was gone for about three weeks. When I got it back there was a note that it was repaired, but it still doesn't record some of my exercise and activity. The battery doesn't seem to hold a charge for very long anymore either. I'm a pretty active person so it's disappointing to not be able to track myself the way I expected. I mostly go on vigorous mountain hikes and bike rides, activities I would expect to be recorded.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: We have experience with cheap pedometers, Fitbit Charge 2, Apple Watch 4th Gen and now Fitbit Flex 2. Even though we've "upgraded" to the Apple and love so much about it, we really missed the sleep tracking and the ability to challenge friends on the Fitbit network- we have a lot of family that use it and getting the Flex 2 helped us have that back! Thanks Fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Psalm 127

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Fitbit devices since the Ultra. My favorite Fitbit was the One, but they don't make that anymore. I would have dinged this one down to four stars because it doesn't track stairs, but I knew that when I bought it. Best feature: supposedly it can survive a trip through the washing machine. I ruined a Zip and a One that way. I haven't put this one to the test, though. Worst feature(s): No stairs tracker, no digital display of steps counted. If you want to see your steps you have to sync.
customer_reviews.author: Sruli

customer_reviews.title: Very simple, very affective.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! The app is great, definitely keeps you on track and pushes you to do more. I wanted something simple, I didn’t need the screen for incoming calls and texts and to monitor everything on my wrist, like the more expensive ones. This works perfect and I just look at my app on my phone when I want to see my progress. I can however have my phone on vibrate in the other room and when I have a incoming call, my wrist will vibrate a couple times, I actually like that. Also, the vibration to remind me to move more is great. I like the challenge/goal aspect of it, while being simple.
customer_reviews.author: margaret jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I've been a pretty loyal Fitbit user for a while now, and decided to purchase the Flex II primarily because this model is waterproof. That's super useful, but now that I have been wearing it a while, I really appreciate the new band design more than anything. It's much slimmer, and can be adjusted down to fit my small wrists perfectly, unlike before. As a nice bonus, the charger is more solidly built now, and the tracker won't slip out like it occasionally did before. If you liked the Flex then this upgrade is totally worth having.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but slowly is losing the ability to auto-track workouts
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fitbit since March of 2018. It does automatically track sleep and some workouts and steps. It has been great! However, 2 years in and counting it now has issues automatically tracking workouts, so I lose a lot of information. It has issues updating to the app. And step tracking is wonky occasionally. I liked it in the beginning, but I need to replace it. Idk how long this device should last, but 2 years is not long for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: Great swimming fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I use this for when I'm in the pool. Love it. I do prefer my charge2 for everything else though. I get more detailed information about sleep, heart rate, workout analysis, etc. But this is great for the pool and sync up perfectly with my charge2 on my phone. It's also really lightweight and comfortable wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Purchased item

customer_reviews.title: Nice small fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.text: This was my replacement for Jawbone up. Problem with jawbone is the bands always stretched and broke. Not an issue for Fitbit with replaceable bands. No complaints about step count, but sleep measuring is not very accurate. It has me sleeping at times I know I was awake. Other times it has me only sleeping 3 hours when I slept through entire night. Silent alarm is a great. I only get about 3-4 days between charges. I do like the small size. I tried charge 2 but found it too bulky and the light from heart rate monitor would flash in room at night when it wasn't tight enough.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Can even use as wake vibrate/alarm
customer_reviews.text: All Pros. No Cons. UNEXPECTED PLUS is that you can set multiple alarms and I set one wake up time for weekdays and one for weekends. Gentle yet sufficient vibration wakes me, now. Ideal if you share a bed and the other doesn’t have to wake when you do. No more startling alarm clock sounds. Has changed my life. If you don’t double tap then it SNOOZES and will vibrate again afer 9 minutes! Great interface with smart phone app. I also really like the report it gives you after a night’s sleep, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesay

customer_reviews.title: just a good basic counter-revised 2/15/19
customer_reviews.text: Finding the battery life to be less than stated in the description. If you travel without a computer this need to charge it every 2.5 days could be a problem. I removed a star for this reason. I didn't need a lot of bells and whistles I just wanted something to help me get motivated. This keeps track of me and helps me remember to move. It hasn't been a problem to use and keeps track of my movement and especially my sleep. I am trying different things to sleep better and this helps me see what is working and what is not.
customer_reviews.author: marmar

customer_reviews.title: Great way to solve a problem!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for one reason only. I am almost deaf when I take my hearing aids out at night. I am unable to consistantly hear an alarm on my phone or radio so needed a different device to wake me up. Rather than buy a medical device for the deaf (expensive), I purchased this Fitbit because it vibrates on my wrist when I set my iPhone alarm and wakes me perfectly every time! Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: IceyS

customer_reviews.title: Many lost connections over bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Fitbit One. Had many problems with the One, but never did it lose a bluetooth connection with my phone in over a year. I've been using the Flex 2 for about 3 days and it has dropped the connection with my iPhone 6 three different times. Very annoying as I have to turn off, then back on bluetooth for it to re-sync.
customer_reviews.author: Bruin248

customer_reviews.title: Best no thrills tracker
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for something simple, small,and Lcan track steps, Etc. More importantly, something that can have alerts and vibrate so you can actually feel them. Didn’t want something with displays or anything because I need glasses to read and I don’t always care my glasses so it’s a waste. I thought I wouldn’t like the fact that it alerts you when you get text messages or emails, but, it is actually really great. I design software for living and the app is a A statically pleasing, not the most intuitive, but, it works once it’s set up. This thing rocks
customer_reviews.author: Meh

customer_reviews.title: great product comes with two bands (small and large)
customer_reviews.text: great product comes with two bands (small and large), charger (USB), syncs well with my phone , so far great battery life as long as you don't have all the alerts (text, phone, etc.) so far I have just phone for incoming call just in case I'm away from my phone. Water proof I haven't tried it yet due to habit of not having on anything when I shower, however I do have a pool but due to the season right now I can't go swimming, looking forward to this summer though. very flexible and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Diane wolford

customer_reviews.title: Unobtrusive, light, and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This device is doing everything it says it will, talks to the Samsung 5 just fine...most of the time. Only issue is it needing occasional reset to get it to talk the the phone. Now and then it hiccups and the new day starts out with the 'step goal' as how many steps you have already walked, wake up and it says 5000, and the days steps add to that, but the next morning it has reset itself to zero.
customer_reviews.author: CALNNC

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof fitness tracker that is inexpensive and low profile
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fitbit Flex 2! I had been looking for a waterproof fitness tracker that was low profile and inexpensive. Fitbit Flex 2 definitely hits all those points, spot on. I enjoy being able to know how my water fitness classes impact my total fitness goals. I am very impressed with the Fitbit Flex 2. It has exceeded my expectations. Only improvement that I could suggest would be to work on improving battery life. I need to recharge the battery every 36 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on a Fitbit Flex2!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on the Fitbit Flex2. I bought this less than six months ago and it has stopped syncing with the app. After doing all the troubleshooting steps I could find online, I chatted with a Fitbit customer service representative. She told me that many other flex2 customers were reporting the same issue and apologized. She said they would not replace because a new Flex2 would likely have the same problem. No solution and no compensation. Very bad customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Martha A.

customer_reviews.title: Tracks steps and sleep, but not exercise
customer_reviews.text: This is ok if you just want to track your steps and sleep patterns. However, it does not track exercise. I can do an intense HIIT workout, yoga, pilates and other exercise, and it will not track it as exercise. It does recognize the steps, though. I bought it to integrate with my WW app, but have to manually track exercise instead. Battery life is typically about three days before it needs a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Roseville Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for Motivating
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the computer a lot so I needed a smartband that didn't have extreme workouts. Fitbit Flex 2 works for me. The one suggestion I'd make is the food diary, because it's for calories only and I'm a carb counter. Also, the woman's section isn't made for older women. But so far, this item has worked just as I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Donna DM Yates

customer_reviews.title: I finally have a swimming buddy!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this fitbit looks like a bracelet. The best feature???? I can SWIM with it! I have been waiting for something I can take with me when I swim. I love the fact that it syncs right to my phone. Battery life is about 3 days, which sucks for me because I hate when I have to charge it. I feel like I loose track of sleep if I charge it at night. I have found that at times, and not very often, it has not tracked a days activity. Not sure if it was just a glitch, but it has happened twice so far. Overall I am extremely happy and in love with my fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: wendbara

customer_reviews.title: I was really happy with my original fitbit flex and the reason I ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fitbit flex 2 in August and have had nothing but problems. It won't sync, won't remember my passwords, doesn't track exercise aside from swimming at all. I was really happy with my original fitbit flex and the reason I upgraded was to track swimming, but I have to manually enter any other exercise even though I have it programmed to recognize various activities. Oh, and it doesn't charge well either. I would not recommend this product. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: denise gibbons

customer_reviews.title: The step count is overly generous, but otherwise I'm really happy with it
customer_reviews.text: The step count is overly generous, but otherwise I'm really happy with the Fitbit Flex 2. I like the fact that it tracks sleep, and that you can set it to remind you get up and move every hour during the day. I just take the step count with a grain of salt, because I've seen it count certain hand movements as steps, such as when I'm petting my cat or brushing my hair. Compared to a waist-mounted pedometer, it's roughly doubling my actual steps in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Minerva

customer_reviews.title: Great for a first timer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I am new to wearing a tracker of any sort. I appreciate that this isn't bulky, and that the charge lasts a few days at least. I love using the fitbit app as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love the fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the fitbit. I never had one and think it’s a great product and I love all of the information it provides. But the reason I am giving it a 3 is because the battery stinks! When I originally read about it it said the battery would last up to 5 days. I am lucky if it lasts 2. That’s my only issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny C Luca

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 4 months - and wildly inaccurate to boot
customer_reviews.text: Lousy QA or bad design - who knows. I hate to be 'that guy' but - it sure seems like the vast majority of products out there are just plain JUNK! Back when I was a kid... ;) OK, in addition to the thing dying on me, gotta say - it wasn't accurate at all. I'd put in 15 minutes on a stationary bike and get 0 active minutes, but riding my motorcycle gave me active minutes. What the?
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 months!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this Fitbit! I used it everyday! It was helping me get to 10,000 steps daily. But it suddenly stopped working on the 29th August. My husbands still works fine but mine is no more! It does not charge! It is not syncing! Really disheartening! I contacted Fitbit directly and they were really nice about! They are replacing it! It is truly refreshing to have such wonderful customer support! I look forward to using the replacement! Will post an update when the replacement is received!
customer_reviews.author: ORattan

customer_reviews.title: Great so far - wife is happy
customer_reviews.text: This was for my wife and she really likes it. She is tracking her steps and sleep and feeding the results into another online app for tracking diet. Just wish the bracelet like band didn't cost almost as much as the fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Dad

customer_reviews.title: Insight gained is good to reach health goals
customer_reviews.text: I love the feedback of steps and motivation to move. It gives goals set by me to excercise four times per week. I like having feed back on my sleep too.I bought the Fitbit because I don’t always carry my iPhone and don’t register all my steps on the Health app. I have been unable to get the weight watchers app to sync with my iPhone 8 pluse. I’ve followed the tutorials, turned the phone off and on, disconnected the app link and reset the link a couple times, turned off Bluetooth and returned it on - nothing works. This four stars.
customer_reviews.author: vickie m larson

customer_reviews.title: It syncs with Nutrisystem if you're on that plan; too bad it's SORELY inaccurate on steps
customer_reviews.text: Sleep is accurate but steps are REALLY way off....like 4 times the amount of steps I've taken. I have tried everything I know to try and make the count more accurate, like placement of Fitbit (even in my pocket it's way off). It must count arm movement too when I'm sitting. I've also changed stride length as well as non-dominant arm placement to no avail. Charging this every 4-5 days is a pain. Syncs your activity with Nutrisystems' NUMI app. I'm going back to my Omron HJ-321 pedometer. It's very accurate on steps.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho Libra

customer_reviews.title: Tracker falls out of wristband
customer_reviews.text: The tracker itself is great. I love it for swimming, however the tracker keeps falling out of the wristband that came with the Fitbit. I'm afraid I'm going to loose it. Update 5/8/2018 - officially fell out of the wristband and lost it. I'd advise to not purchase this product. Its too bad, because I really liked that it tracked my swimming laps. But if I loose it, then what good is it. I've had this less than 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: I liked it better than my Charge which was big and ...
customer_reviews.text: this is smaller and more feminine and is waterproof as stated. I liked it better than my Charge which was big and clunky and had to be removed while showering. But if you wear the band that comes with it, it can come off, and even if buy the other band, the hardware comes off. I am not hard on things at all, so I can't fathom why they can't come up with something that works better. I lost one charge in the winter when it slipped off my wrist while running errands, and now this one doesn't seem to want to stay on either. "-(
customer_reviews.author: Voyager2017

customer_reviews.title: Poor product, zero battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I have had numerous Fitbit Zips and loved them but always lose them so tried this. Disaster. Syncs maybe 50 % of the time on a good day. Battery life is ummm, 2 days with full charge. I almost never write a negative review but this is the worst Amazon purchase I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: appgap

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad battery
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, particularly that I can swim with it and the sleep tracking feature. I had a previous Fitbit that was chunky and it was not durable so I like the simplicity of this one. My one complaint is that the battery dies so quickly. I had only had it a few days, charged it completely and then went out of town for 4 days for the fourth without the charger and it completely died. I’ve only had it a little more than a week and I’ve had to charge it three times already! It’s been a few years since I had my other Fitbit but I definitely did not have to charge it nearly this much
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: We love our fitbits
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for me and one for my wife. WE love them and wear them everyday, it tracks everything from steps to hours slept. It has gotten us more active with nice couple competitions between the two of us. It vibrates and lights up when you get a call or text. The lights blink to show your step progression. It has a great battery lasting at a minimum of 3 straight days, with a fast charge time of only a couple hours. I'm not one for all the techno-workouts but this is a good tracker and can be a nice motivator.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Love the fact you can buy different bracelets and wear ...
customer_reviews.text: This style, in particular, was purchased for a pre-teen. I wanted him to follow our active lifestyle but I was concern he could be careless with any of the screen ones. Well, we nailed it with this one! He doesn't need a watch (yes, you don't get a display). Lights seem more attracting to pre-teens. It is waterproof (perfect reason for him to keep it at all times and no chance to misplace/lose it). Love the fact you can buy different bracelets and wear according to what you wear. It still tracks your steps, heart rate, and sleep. Yep, it was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Chili

customer_reviews.title: ... bit flex for approximately 2 months and it worked great for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I've had my fit bit flex for approximately 2 months and it worked great for awhile. . .but now it is refusing to hold a charge for more than 1 day, isn't picking up exercise sessions and being finicky about the blue tooth link to my phone. I'd like to return it but have to figure out how. After the first month, it stopped being useful because it stopped automatically logging movement, I'd have to manually enter sleep times, exercise sessions etc, what's the point if I have enter the info myself?
customer_reviews.author: RDG

customer_reviews.title: life changer
customer_reviews.text: literally has completely changed my life....i was someone that was in the 3,000+ steps a day on average range.....i have almost triple that because of this device and that constant reminder to be healthy and active has spilled over into other parts of my life such as watching what i eat....wish the exact same sized device came with a heart rate monitor, super comfortable to wear while sleeping...
customer_reviews.author: M. G.

customer_reviews.title: User friendly, small design looks like jewelry.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Exactly what I wanted. It is small and easy to use. Only thing I don't like is I have to turn on my location to connect it to the app... Not a fan of that. Just seems weird. Anyways it's accurate and helps me track my sleep too. Battery lasts about 2-4 days depending on how many times I sync it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wheatie

customer_reviews.title: The Flea 2
customer_reviews.text: Just love it! I can wear it when i go surfing or swimming. Now i have an idea about my workout regimes. I wish the battery would last longer. I m getting a little more than 3+ days on a charge. Other than that, I'm totally happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 93minpin

customer_reviews.title: Great but stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this Fitbit but it stopped working after only 11 months and I haven't been able to get a hold of their support to figure out what happened. I believe something went wrong with the Bluetooth capabilities as it no longer broadcasts any Bluetooth signal despite a full charge. All that being said, I absolutely loved how simple and sleek the style of this Fitbit is. It doesn't have a lot of features but you honestly forget you're wearing it, and the vibrate for alarms/texts/calls is actually quite effective. I would have given a much higher rating if I had even gotten a response from their support.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Adams

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy it while it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the flex 2 because of the slim band and swimming feature. Worked like a charm for just over three months. One day after a full charge all the lights flashed and danced like crazy. I also could not get it to sync. Bluetooth would not pick it up. After TWO hours of trouble shooting I’ve finally given up. This was my second Fitbit (my Fitbit Charge 2 lasted about 30 months). Seven friends/family members were on their second or third Fitbits then decided not to purchase any more. I too, will join the dead Fitbit club as I will not purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Slick's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Read the Reviews!
customer_reviews.text: OKay...These needs an.UPDATE!!! The little device fell out of the band! It was great working until today. It was a little loose fitting in the band that came with it so I ordered extra bands but they were even loose. So i went back to the one it came with because I was afraid it would fall out. Well, it happened! Today it fell out. I can't find it anywhere. Beyond bummed out. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: JourneyinFaith

customer_reviews.title: Great for counting steps and tracking sleep.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it said it would. The main thing I use this for, so far, is to check my sleep pattern and count my steps. I have sleep apnea so it is very important to know how well I am actually sleeping. I bought this model because I was planning on using it while doing water exercising. So far, I have not done any water exercises and wish I had the one, like my husband, that is also a watch and has a readout for information rather than the dots and me needing to go to my phone for more data.
customer_reviews.author: TRW

customer_reviews.title: Making better health choices!
customer_reviews.text: Best investment I have made for my son and I. We weren't looking for anything overly fancy or too pricey and the Flex 2 was the right choice. I wanted something that would teach him how to better maintain his health and the Flex 2 and the phone App have turned it into almost a game for him. He has lost weight, walks daily to meet his goals, inputs his own food, and has learned to make better choices in food selection. We even compare our daily stats. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Helmer

customer_reviews.title: did not even last a year!
customer_reviews.text: a month ago, it stopped telling me when I had a call from my phone. Last week, it stopped telling me when to move and then the lights stopped working to tell me if I met my goal. The last one lasted just about 2 years and this one not even more than 7 months. Don't think I would buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Denise Fuller

customer_reviews.title: but that would have been a good chunk of change down the drain if he had ...
customer_reviews.text: Between my family and I, we have every FITBIT ever made and this was the only one so far that has given us a scare. My husband was making my son's bed and the small fitbit part that is inserted in the back of the wrist piece actually fell out and he didn't notice for a few hours. Luckily he was able to retrace his steps and locate it, but that would have been a good chunk of change down the drain if he had lost it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper W

customer_reviews.title: I like that it tracks steps and activity and calories etc
customer_reviews.text: I like that it tracks steps and activity and calories etc. I very much DO NOT like that it will not sync with the app regularly. Having read the troubleshooting on line at the vendor site I do what it says, it works for maybe a day and then I have to do it all over again. So unless I can see how I am doing with the app, the thing is rather useless. Which is sad as it worked very well the first week or two. I tried calling the vendor, phone no longer in service. the is no live chat. Rather feeling like it is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: have to charge it every 1-2 days
customer_reviews.text: I like what this gadget does, but I have 2 complaints: first I could not sync it with my computer which I wanted to do because it's easier for me to read things on my computer than my phone. 2econd, and worse, I'm needing to charge it every 1-2 days. I expected it to go several days without a charge. I would have returned it if I knew it wouldn't hold a charge ....
customer_reviews.author: J Bird

customer_reviews.title: Works for steps but not impressed with other capabilities
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fit-bit so I could use it while swimming and doing water aerobics. It picks up steps with no issue but most of the time it does not really pick up my workouts when I am swimming or doing water aerobics. I love that it is waterproof but I hate that I have to have my location turned on, on my phone, in order to sync it. All-in-all it works okay but I am not really overwhelmed with its capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: K Fordyce

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Charging At 3 Weeks - UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: My fitbit stopped holding a charge after just a couple weeks. It was never in water or damaged in any way. I contacted Customer Service at FitBit and they had me reset it by pressing 3x the small button on the charger while battery was inserted. All lights blinked including the red 1x and I was told that indicated the fitbit had been reset. Then to charge for 90 minutes and see if the problem is resolved after wearing it for 2 days. I will change my star rating to 5 if the problem is resolved. Customer Service/Support is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: MEM

customer_reviews.title: Mine lasted only 8 months
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit was good for awhile. The app was a pain, as it sometimes wouldn't sync (others have had this problem). I used mine everyday and was very careful not to get it wet, bump it or abuse it in any way. I got very frustrated at the lack of syncing and the app being down most of the time. This item is too expensive for the hassle of it not working most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo K.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item since Sept 1, 2017 and it stopped working after a few weeks. It is completely dead and will not charge or record anything. I really wanted this to work as I am training for a triathlon and need these tools to help with my sessions. I have had many fitbit products in the past and loved them but was very disappointed with this item.
customer_reviews.author: alvinleejohnson

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate so far
customer_reviews.text: Due to the holidays and being sick I haven't had the time to exercise and swim, but the sleep tracking is completely on point. The app that goes with it is great for tracking calories, water intake, and it does synch via Bluetooth to the device so my steps are on it in real time. Love this little thing so far, will update once I can get to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Cross

customer_reviews.title: Fun but disappointing battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use as a silent alarm and ended up enjoying tracking my activity throughout the day. I’ve counted my steps and then checked the app and it’s surprisingly accurate. The battery life is disappointing. I went through the app and shut down every function besides step counting, goal attainment notification and one silent alarm (occasionally) and it still does not last as long as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: FiestyBerry

customer_reviews.title: The perfect encouragement for winter walking
customer_reviews.text: The best feature of the Fitbit Flex 2 is that I can set it up to buzz/vibrate each hour to remind me to walk. For someone who sits at a desk most of the day, this has been a great way to make sure I am getting up and walking, even when it's cold and snowy outside. It keeps a charge for several days and even tracks my sleep. I am so glad I got this and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Schorr

customer_reviews.title: Another pure garbage product from Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: This thing is horrible. The battery life is bad (3 days?!), the step detection doesn't work at all, and the app is terrible. The only good product Fitbit has ever made was their original tracker. Avoid this one like the cheap chinese junk it is.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Buhrkuhl

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I never had a fitbit until now, because they were just too big and bulky in the past. The FitBit Flex 2 is completely different. It has a slim design and can be placed in a classy bangle or pendent (for a little extra). It doesn't even look like I'm wearing a fitness band. Keeps track of steps, distance, calories, and sleep. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Lane

customer_reviews.title: A good basic tracker.
customer_reviews.text: This tracker is still going. I didn’t want the fancy ones, just something basic that tracked steps and a few other things (ie sleep). I also wanted something with a big enough band to be worn around my ankle as I’ve found this to be more accurate than when I wore a tracker on my wrist. My only issue is that now that it’s getting older I can no longer see the lights thru the band so I have to check the app to see my progress. For that reason I will be upgrading to the newer version of this that has a digital display.
customer_reviews.author: Kenya Lott

customer_reviews.title: I like this one because it's a lot slimmer and doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: My old Flex was starting to die, so I needed to get a new one. I like this one because it's a lot slimmer and doesn't have that many bells and whistles. I like the vibrating reminder notifications to move and for when I get text messages. The only thing I don't like is that I have the small band, and I wear it pretty tight. The excess band hangs out kind of awkwardly - I wish there were a loop or something to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Annie J.

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review...
customer_reviews.text: I'll update my review when I get my replacement, but right out of the box, the Flex 2 would not vibrate when I would get notifications. I went through every troubleshooting walk through that I could find and even dealt with their Support Center. This is my first Fitbit and it's not off to a good start. Hopefully the replacement works properly. *Update* Received my new Flex 2 today and it is working flawlessly, so far. Just what I was hoping for. Curious to see how well it monitors my sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility of this Fitbit! I purchased the Alta first and it was too bulky for my taste, so I returned it and purchased the flex2 and love it! I have purchased bracelets of different colors to wear along with something coverlers and a metal bracelet so I have a variety to go with my outfits! Counts my steps and alerts when texts and calls come through!
customer_reviews.author: Darlori

customer_reviews.title: I love this tracker
customer_reviews.text: I love this tracker. Syncs easily and you can get it wel without fear. I am a nurse and am constantly washing my hands. I have bought several bands for it and they clean up easily with soap water and a toothbruch. The lines in the plastic can catch dirt and debris...but again it cleans up so easily. I also ordered a couple of dangle bracelets for it. I have one from fitbit and another from an online retailer...I would suggest you get the fitbit one there is a huge difference in quality...you get what you pay for...believe me the same goes for the pendant.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni83

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I like that it is waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I like that it is waterproof. Would like the bit to stay in the band a little better because it popped out when I was rough housing with my dog. Almost lost it but found an app, "Find My Fitbit" that helped my locate it in the living room. The Flex 2 works great, and keeps me motivated. Also made me realize that I should be getting more sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. Powell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the waterproof feature!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this fitbit. I had wanted a fitbit for awhile but never got one because I couldn't get it wet. We have a pool and I am always going in and out of the pool also sticking my hands in to get random dog toys out, etc. This works fabulous for that! I don't have to worry about taking it off first. I also really enjoy the hour reminder to get up and move. I will get so focused on my work that I won't get up for several hours. This reminds me to get up and walk around. It's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Not as full-featured as any of the Fitbits that have ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as full-featured as any of the Fitbits that have screens, but if you're looking for a second tracker to wear during strenuous workouts or sports without needing a HR monitor, this is solid. Stands up well to a fair amount of abuse while playing dek hockey, lightweight, and does the job of tracking steps.
customer_reviews.author: dbecker801

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the person who doesn't want a fitbit with a watch face.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband as a gift. It is perfect for him - he works in construction and didn't want a fitbit with a watch face. We thought it would get scratched. It is nice for him to see how active he is each day. Fits great - he is a big guy and I was a little worried that it wouldn't fit his large wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Newton

customer_reviews.title: No heart rate functionality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention for swimming as it is marketed. For $60 it doesn't come with a screen which is fine, but it doesn't even come with a heart rate monitor. It is effectively a $60 pedometer, which comes in most smartphones nowadays... I'm a broke graduate student so I can't afford the Charge 3. I was hoping to get the same functionality without the touchscreen at a lower cost, but fitbit doesn't offer this. My options are to either get the flagship model for a bunch of money or an off-brand model with HR for less than $40. Either way I don't see a use for this model.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product Support / Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I took this device overseas for a vacation and after a weekend of hiking I checked my phone and found that the device had not recorded anything. I contacted support and after having to explain the issue multiple times and several times back and forth with support they finally said basically "oh well". This device is defective and they will do nothing about it. I don't trust this company anymore. If they don't feel this is defective then they are saying this is common.. There can be no other explanation. What is the purpose of either keeping a product that doesn't work or a company that doesn't stand by their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fitbit.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy my fit bit. I purchased it to replace the one I lost. I have been using a Fitbit flex for three years. Helps me stay on track. Although steps and calorie calculations are not totally accurate. At least it has given me something to go by. I have been able to lose 50 lbs and maintain with it.
customer_reviews.author: jlhamster

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it. I bought her a necklace since she doesn't care for things on her wrist, and she removed the unit from the black wrist band and keeps it in the necklace. The unit is water tight. After some troubleshooting with tech support, she did have to reset it for the battery to last the 3-4 days it's supposed to last on 1 charge. Apparently this is a known issue.
customer_reviews.author: W Bee

customer_reviews.title: Love this Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I love this fitbit. I does exactly what I need it to do: record my swimming and my sleep. If these are two things you are looking for in a fitbit this is the one for you. I'm happy to see there are options for so many lifestyles.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Books

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a small tracker. I use this item primarily in the gym for elliptical and swimming and at home for sleep tracking. My smart watch is not swimproof. This tracker is accurate and detects workout correctly and gives accurate time and step count. I really like it, What else to say, it works perfectly for me. Update: Great little thing. Records automatically elliptical exercise and swimming very accurately. It gives alerts to calls and text messages so you can answer it or not while in the gym. I am really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great deal - great fitness tracker!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for a fitness tracker! You can easily exchange the band for any color. This tracker is truly waterproof for swimming and even tracks sleeping. I would highly recommend! Just be careful not to loose the tracker itself as it’s barely an inch long.
customer_reviews.author: Katie23

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit works fine, doesn't track HR though
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit works fine, doesn't track HR though. Delivery was a bit iffy, not sure this relates to the product or seller- but my package showed up about 5 days after it was marked as delivered. I do like how the band will buzz when you have an incoming call. Hopefully buyers will know other people with Fitbits using the app, otherwise it might be boring. Fitbit needs to be recharged about every three days.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Easily lost - design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: I loved my fitbit flex until I lost it. Wanting a replacement I bought the Flex 2. Had some difficulty synching with my android phone but could synch via laptop so it was ok. Overall I was "happy". Learning from my experience of losing my first flex, I checked my wristband regularly and also made sure it's snug around my wrist. Long story short, I lost 2 more Flex 2, they slip out of the wristband; and the wristband is NOT broken or damaged in any way. There is no easy way to contact Fitbit unless you have a Twitter account or want to "chat" with them.
customer_reviews.author: ash

customer_reviews.title: Great until the battery sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this. But it hasn't lasted one year before the battery has reduced to 20% of it's original life. I now can't go a full day without charging which is annoying because I love using the steps count and the sleep tracker. It's sitting on my wrist right now completely dead from a full charge less than 14 hours ago.
customer_reviews.author: lisa manley

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't do anything that I would like to track (stairs and heart rate)
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't do anything that I would like to track (stairs and heart rate). It disconnects from the app and doesn't sync for days without notice. It is not a problem of battery. The battery is full when this happens. The move notifications are erratic. Conclusion: unreliable and useless for my activity level. I don't swim. The only useful thing is that you can change the band
customer_reviews.author: Yotuel

customer_reviews.title: Great slim Fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: I only wanted the basics because I am also an Apple Watch user. I want something slim enough that I can wear them both on the same wrist without looking crazy. They complement each other! I think the band looks better on my arm in front of my Apple Watch so the button aren't blocked.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R Doran

customer_reviews.title: Terrible band
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than a year ago and during that time it has slipped off my wrist no less than 20 times. Luckily I was aware that it was slipping off my wrist. That is until today. The shoddy clasp must have opened up and it is gone. I traced me steps (pun intended) but cannot locate it anywhere. I like the Fitbit but the band is just awful. I will NOT buy another one and neither should anyone until then can design a better band!!
customer_reviews.author: Yancx

customer_reviews.title: Replacement unit
customer_reviews.text: had one before but the sensor fell out of band while traveling. I like the sleep track feature. Stylish band.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Take you time when setting up your Flex 2.
customer_reviews.text: I was confused by the packaging. Did not realize it contained a small and large band. Taking the claps out of the small band and placing in the large band was difficult. In my defense, I’m on the second day of a Master Cleanse and I’m kind of “HANGRY”! LoL! Now that I’ve pretty much figured everything out, I’ve gone back and revised my rating. It appears this device is going to work out fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: This fit the bill perfectly It reminds me of my Jawbone and is easy to wear
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the FitBit Charge 2 - and while I have no complaints about the product itself (intuitive, tracks everything), it just wasn't for me. Too bulky, too busy, and I didn't want to replace my analog watch. I really wanted something to track my movement - and that's all. This fit the bill perfectly It reminds me of my Jawbone and is easy to wear. No fuss and a better price point. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Martha K. DeSilva

product_meta.title: Fitbit Flex 2, Black (US Version), 1 Count
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackMeet the all-new Fitbit Flex 2—a slim, swim-proof fitness wristband that’s ready to go wherever life takes you. The ultra-thin, removable tracker hides in bands, bangles and pendants, so you can wear it in a way that’s all your own. Automatic all-day activity and sleep tracking show you how your entire day adds up, and SmartTrack automatic exercise recognition records your exercises for you. The discreet progress display uses color-coded LED lights to keep you connected to calls, texts and Reminders to Move. Plus you don’t have to worry about getting it wet—whether you’re swimming in the pool or running in the rain. It’s the next generation model of our most iconic tracker. No fuss, all fun, and fit for every you.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Customers contact: support@fitbit.com
feature_bullets: Track steps, distance, calories burned and active minutes; LED display lights up to show progress toward your daily goal
Ultra thin, removable tracker hides in bands, pendants and bangles
Swim proof for tracking swimming, life proof for wear in the ocean, shower, pool and beyond
SmartTrack automatically recognizes select workouts and records them to your Fitbit app
Get call and text notifications on your wrist with unique vibration patterns and color coded LED lights
Automatically track how long and how well you sleep, and set a silent alarm to wake with a small vibration
Fitbit does not guarantee the quality or authenticity of products purchased from non authorized re sellers on Amazon, and they are not eligible for warranty/replacement
Authorized Fitbit retailers: Amazon.com, Heart Rate Monitors USA and Clever Training
